problem:
What is the value of $$
(3x-2)(4x+1)-(3x-2)4x+1
$$ when $x=4$?
solution:
Since \begin{align*}
(3x-2)(4x+1)-(3x-2)4x+1 &=(3x-2)(4x+1-4x)+1 \\
&=(3x-2) \cdot 1 +1 =3x-1,
\end{align*} when $x=4$ we have the value $3 \cdot 4 -1 =\boxed{11}$.
model_solution:
## Step 1: Substitute $x=4$ into the expression
$$(3(4)-2)(4(4)+1)-(3(4)-2)4(4)+1$$
## Step 2: Evaluate the expressions inside the parentheses
$$(10)(17)-(10)(16)+1$$
$$
(10)(17)-(10)(16)+1=(170)-(160)+1
$$
## Step 3: Perform the subtractions and addition
$$(170)-(160)+1=10+1$$
## Step 4: Evaluate the final expression
$10+1=11$
The final answer is: $\boxed{11}$
